intro: Boucerosia mammillaris, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant has milky sap that is toxic to some animals, including humans, if ingested. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Boucerosia mammillaris thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
